content: Yes, there are modern examples of writers who have used anonymity to enhance the impact of their writing. One notable example is Elena Ferrante, the pseudonym of an anonymous Italian novelist. Ferrante's works, such as the Neapolitan Novels, have received widespread critical acclaim and commercial success, partly due to the mystery surrounding her true identity. By remaining anonymous, Ferrante has allowed her work to speak for itself, without the distraction of personal details or celebrity status. Another example is the whistleblower known as "Deep Throat", who provided information to journalists during the Watergate scandal, thus contributing to the downfall of US President Richard Nixon. Deep Throat's true identity was not revealed until 2005, adding to the mystique and impact of their role in this political scandal. These examples show how anonymity can be a powerful tool in modern writing and politics, just as it was in Junius's time.
